---
title: "Inference with Mathematical Models" # title 
subtitle: "If all else fails, use 'significant at p>.05 level' and hope no one notices. Ref: https://xkcd.com/1478/?" # sub title
description: "10/05-10/10" #date range
---

::: {.cell}

:::


## Learning Path

### Where we've been
Learning about different data generating mechanisms/models. 

### Where we're at
Refreshing our memory from a prior stat class how to use the Normal distribution to compare values, calculate probabilities, confidence intervals and conduct a hypothesis test 

### Objectives


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
* Explain how to test a hypothsis using randomization
  * Assess a research question using a hypothesis test
  * Use the Normal distribution to calculate a probability
  * Describe the concept of sampling variability
  * Calculate the mean and sd of the sampling distribution based on population parameters
  * Explain the Central Limit Theorem
  * Construct and Interpret a confidence interval in context of the problem
  * Use a confidence interval to make an inferential hypothesis statement

<!-- end of list -->
:::
:::
